author: Bindu Shajan Perappadan
text:
Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mufti Mohammad Sayeed continues to be critical but stable, according to a statement released by the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) here on Saturday.

Currently Mr. Sayeed is on broad spectrum antibiotics, antifungal treatment, and is being given oxygen therapy for lung infection.

His condition is being closely monitored by a team of experts, said a senior physician. “Mr. Sayeed, who is admitted to AB 8 Intensive Care Unit [ICU] since December 24, is sick, requiring oxygen therapy but hemodynamically stable. He is conscious and alert. He continues to be on antibiotics, antifungal drugs and supportive therapy and is being closely monitored by a team of experts,” the doctor added.
title: Mufti is still critical but stable
